I/O Utilities (fd_greens.utils.io_utils)

initialize_hdf5(fname: str = 'lih', calc: str = 'greens') → None[source]

Creates the HDF5 file and group names if they do not exist.

The group created in the HDF5 file are: gs (for ground-state calculation), eh (for (N+/-1)-state calculation)), amp (for transition amplitude calculation), circ0 (the (0, 0)-element circuit), circ1 (the (1, 1)-element circuit), circ01 (The (0, 1)-element circuit).

Parameters

  • fname – The HDF5 file name.

  • calc – Calculation mode. Either ‘greens’ or ‘resp’.

write_hdf5(h5file: h5py._hl.files.File, grpname: str, dsetname: str, data: Any, overwrite: bool = True) → None[source]

Writes a data object to a dataset in an HDF5 file.

Parameters

  • h5file – The HDF5 file.

  • grpname – The name of the group to save the data under.

  • dsetname – The name of the dataset to save the data to.

  • data – The data to be saved.

  • overwrite – Whether the dataset is overwritten.

circuit_to_qasm_str(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit) → str[source]

Converts a circuit to QASM string.

This function generates QASM string of the C0iXC0 gate and is required to transpile circuits that contain this gate, as the QASM string generation function in Qiskit does not implement this gate.

Parameters

circ – The circuit to be transformed to a QASM string.

Returns

qasm_str – The QASM string corresponding to the circuit.

save_circuit_figure(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, suffix: str) → None[source]

Saves the circuit figure under the directory figs.

Parameters

  • circ – The circuit to be saved.

  • suffix – The suffix to be appended to the figure name.
